Overview and Scope</h2></div></div></div><div class="toc"><p><b>Table of Contents</b></p><dl><dt><span class="section"><a href="#id2853574">Introduction</a></span></dt><dt><span class="section"><a href="#id3726556">Rationale</a></span></dt></dl></div><p>

This document describes geis,
an interface between an application and an underlying gesture recognition system.
  </p><div class="section" title="Introduction"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id2853574"></a>Introduction</h2></div></div></div><p>
A <acronym class="acronym">GEIS</acronym> implementation provides a mechanism for recognizing
user interface gestures on various configurable devices and for propagating
those recognized gestures to subscribed applications.
    </p></div><div class="section" title="Rationale"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3726556"></a>Rationale</h2></div></div></div><p>
The purpose of geis is to provide a consistent and stable application
programming interface for gesture recognition and propagation on multiple target
platforms (for example, Linux, Unix, and Windows), multiple target input devices
(for example mice, touch pads, mutitouch touchscreens, tables, nunchuks), and
multiple alternative gesture recognition engines.  Different gesture engines may
be available on the same platform.
    </p><p>
To the extent possible, geis itself is independent of definitions and concepts
specific to any native input systems or display or other feedback systems.
there are, however, some places where native concepts must be mapped to the more
abstract geis concepts, including the definition of native windows used for
constraining gesture recognition on input devices to a specific region.
    </p></div></div><div class="chapter" title="Chapter 2.  Operation"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title"><a id="id2859471"></a>Chapter 2.  Operation</h2></div></div></div><p>
The general usage of geis is the following sequence of operations.
      </p><div class="procedure"><ol class="procedure" type="1"><li class="step" title="Step 1">initialize geis</li><li class="step" title="Step 2">enumerate the available gesture-capable input devices</li><li class="step" title="Step 3">enumerate the available gesture types</li><li class="step" title="Step 4">create gesture regions</li><li class="step" title="Step 5">create gesture filters for various input devices, gesture types, and regions</li><li class="step" title="Step 6">create gesture subscriptions for various filters</li><li class="step" title="Step 7">add gesture subscriptions to geis</li><li class="step" title="Step 8">main loop: handle gesture and touch events</li><li class="step" title="Step 9">dispose of geis</li></ol></div><p>

    </p></div><div class="chapter" title="Chapter 3. Interface"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title"><a id="id3726773"></a>Chapter 3. id="id2859185"></a>General Types</h2></div></div></div><p>

This specification makes use of several basic types that are defined more
exactly by the language bindings.
    </p><p>
The fundamental basic types include the following.
      </p><div class="variablelist"><dl><dt><span class="term">string</span></dt><dd><p>textual data</p></dd><dt><span class="term">boolean</span></dt><dd><p>values on the range [true, false]</p></dd><dt><span class="term">cardinal</span></dt><dd><p>integral numeric values</p></dd><dt><span class="term">real</span></dt><dd><p>real-valued numeric values</p></dd></dl></div><p>
    </p><p>
The compound fundamental type include the following.
      </p><div class="variablelist"><dl><dt><span class="term">listOf ..</span></dt><dd><p>a collection of ..</p></dd><dt><span class="term">rangeOf</span></dt><dd><p>an ordered pair of .. indicating the range [min, max]</p></dd></dl></div><p>

    </p></div><div class="section" title="Geis"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3726838"></a>Geis</h2></div></div></div><p>
    The geis object encapsulates an instance of the underlying API implementation.
    Because it may be necessary to allocate (and deallocate) resources,
    such as network connections or dynamically loaded objects,
    the API implementation is given object semantics to allow control of resource
    allocation or deallocation by the application.
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3726852"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><p>
      The geis object has a number of implicit state variables
      acessible through the configuration interface.
      In addition,
      there is an implicit event queue state variable.
      None of these implicit state variables are a part of the specified
      public interface of the geis object except as documented under
      Actions below.
    </p></div><div class="section" title="Actions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3726867"></a>Actions</h3></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Open"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3726872"></a><code class="function">Open</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

All gestures originate through gesture-capable input devices.
Such devices might include mice, touchscreens, touchpads, tables,
gloves, or other manipulation devices.
  </p><p>
An application may choose to accept gestural input from any capable input device
or to limit gesture input to that from one or a select few input devices,
as required.
To allow this,
the geis API delivers events indicating the availability,
or unavailability,
of all capable device and the application may decide to include the devices
in the list of those of interest as it sees fit.
Each gesture device event delivered contains a list of zero or more attributes
the application may use to make this decision.
  </p><p>
Input devices may be capable of appearing or disappearing dynamically
during the life of an application.
  </p><p>
There are two main classes of input devices:
relative (such as mice or trackpads) and absolute (such as touchscreens).
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3727697"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Allowed Values</th><th>Default Value</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">device_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">device_name</code></td><td>string</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">device_attr_count</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">device_attrs</code></td><td>listOf <span class="type">GeisAttr</span></td><td>device attributes</td><td>n/a</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="device_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3727822"></a><code class="varname">device_id</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

Uniquely identifies the particular gesture-capable input device.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="device_name"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3727834"></a><code class="varname">device_name</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
The name of the gesture-capable input device as given by the system.  The input device name is not guarantted to be unique.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="device_attr_count"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3727846"></a><code class="varname">device_attr_count</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	The number of <span class="type">GeisAttr</span> values in the <code class="varname">device_attrs</code> list.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="device_attrs"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3727864"></a><code class="varname">device_attrs</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
A collection of device attributes as identified by the system.
      </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Actions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3727875"></a>Actions</h3></div></div></div><p>

There are no specified actions that may be performed on input devices.
    </p></div><div class="section" title="Events"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3727885"></a>Events</h3></div></div></div><p>
      The following events related to input devices may be received any time
      between geis open and close actions.
    </p><div class="section" title="GeisInputDeviceAvailable"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3727897"></a><span class="type">GeisInputDeviceAvailable</span></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Indicates a new gesture-capable input device has become available.
	Applications may choose to modify existing filters to add the new device,
	and may wish to track available input devices explicitly.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="GeisInputDeviceUnavailable"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3727912"></a><span class="type">GeisInputDeviceUnavailable</span></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Indicates a gesture-capable input device has become unavailble.
	The device will automatically be removed from existing filters.
	This event is delivered to applications in case they are explicitly
	tracking available input devices.
      </p></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Gesture Types"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3727915"></a>Gesture Types</h2></div></div></div><p>
    A gesture type is a defined sequence of gestural actions
    with specific relations to each other.
    For example,
    a <span class="emphasis"><em>pinch</em></span> gesture type applies to a gesture in which two
    or more touches are moving toward (or away from) each other,
    whereas a <span class="emphasis"><em>drag</em></span> gesture has one or more
    touches moving approximately parallel to each other.
  </p><p>

    Gesture types are defined by the underlying gesture recognition engine and,
    if available,
    any programmable gesture recognition engine present.
    Gesture types are mae available to the application
    to allow for only a subset of available gesture types to be chosen for
    recognition.
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3727960"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Allowed Values</th><th>Default Value</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">type_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">type_name</code></td><td>string</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">type_attr_count</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">type_attrs</code></td><td>listOf <span class="type">GeisAttr</span></td><td>gesture type attributes</td><td>n/a</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="type_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728088"></a><code class="varname">type_id</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

Uniquely identifies the gesture type.  The gesture type id is generated by the system.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="type_name"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728099"></a><code class="varname">type_name</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
A user-friendly gesture type name.  The gesture type name is not guaranteed to be unique.  It is determined by elements of the udnerlying gesture recognition pipeline (fixed or programmable) and may be localized.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="type_attr_count"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728113"></a><code class="varname">type_attr_count</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
The number of gesture type attributes in <code class="varname">type_attrs</code>.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="type_attrs"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728128"></a><code class="varname">type_attrs</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
A list of <span class="type">GeisAttrs</span> associated with the identified gesture type.  A given gesture instance may or may not have all of the gesture attributes enumerated in this list.
      </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Actions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3728145"></a>Actions</h3></div></div></div><p>

There are no specified actions that may be performed on gesture types.
    </p></div><div class="section" title="Events"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3728155"></a>Events</h3></div></div></div><p>
      The following events related to gesture types may be received any time
      between geis open and close actions.
    </p><div class="section" title="GeisGestureTypeAvailable"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728166"></a><span class="type">GeisGestureTypeAvailable</span></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Indicates a new gesture type has become available.
	Applications may choose to modify existing filters to
	add the new gesture type,
	and may wish to track available gesture types explicitly.
      </p><p>
	During noremal geis operation, a separate event for each gesture type
	defined in the fixed recognition pipeline should be delivered prior to
	setting any subscriptions.  Gesture types defined in the programmable
	recognition pipeline may appear and disappear at any time as programs
	are loaded or unloaded.
      </p></div><div class="section" title="GeisGestureTypeUnavailable"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728190"></a><span class="type">GeisGestureTypeUnavailable</span></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Indicates a gesture type has become unavailable.
	This event is not expected to be delivered if only a fixed recognition
	pipeline is available, but may be delivered if a programmable
	recognition pipeline is in use.
      </p></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Regions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3728206"></a>Regions</h2></div></div></div><p>

    Regions are used to describe feeback areas (for example, windows on a screeen) in which gestural input is accepted.
  </p><p>
An application is very likely,
but not required,
to limit its acceptance of gestures to those performed in its own
feedback regions.  
For example,
most applications would be ibnterested only in those gestures
performed within its own windows on the screen.
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3728228"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Allowed Values</th><th>Default Value</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">region_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="region_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728290"></a><code class="varname">region_id</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
Uniquely identifies the particular region.
Generated automatically on creation of the region.
      </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Actions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3728302"></a>Actions</h3></div></div></div><div class="section" title="CreateRegion"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728307"></a><code class="function">CreateRegion</code></h4></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728313"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728325"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728337"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div></div><div class="section" title="DestroyRegion"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728348"></a><code class="function">DestroyRegion</code></h4></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728350"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728366"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728377"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Filters"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3728391"></a>Filters</h2></div></div></div><p>

Filters are use to limit the gestures recognized by the underlying
gesture recognition pipeline in some way.
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3728402"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Allowed Values</th><th>Default Value</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">filter_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="filter_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728465"></a><code class="varname">filter_id</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
Uniquely identifies the particular filter.
Generated automatically on creation of the filter.
      </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Actions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3728478"></a>Actions</h3></div></div></div><div class="section" title="CreateFilter"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728483"></a><code class="function">CreateFilter</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Creates a new empty filter object.
	This action may be implemnted as a class constructor
	by the language bindings.
      </p><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728494"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div>

      	This action requires no arguments.
      </div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728495"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  Creates a new filter object.
	</p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728511"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div></div><div class="section" title="DestroyFilter"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728522"></a><code class="function">DestroyFilter</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Destroys an existing filter object.
	This action may be implemnted as a class destructor or finalizer
	by the language bindings.
      </p><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728534"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">filter_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="filter_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3728591"></a><code class="varname">filter_id</code></h6></div></div></div>

	  Identifies the filter to destroy.
	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728600"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  Destroys an identified filter object.
	  Further operations on the filter object are invalid
	  and will raise an error condition.
	</p><p>
	  Destroyed filters will be automatically removed from any subscriptions
	  to which they have been added.
	</p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728618"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div></div><div class="section" title="AddInputDevice"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728628"></a><code class="function">AddInputDevice</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Adds an input device to the filter.
	A filter will allow gestures only from those input devices explicitly
	added.
      </p><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728640"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">device_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="device_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3728696"></a><code class="varname">device_id</code></h6></div></div></div><p>

	    Identifies the input device to be added.
	  </p><p>
	    The special value
	    <code class="constant">GEIS_ALL_INPUT_DEVICES</code>
	    may be used to create a filter that will allow gestures
	    from all available input devices.
	  </p><p>
	    The default action of a filter is
	    to allow no input devices to be used for gesture recognition.
	  </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728724"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728733"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  <span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span>

	</p></div></div><div class="section" title="RemoveInputDevice"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728748"></a><code class="function">RemoveInputDevice</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Removes an input device froms the filter.
      </p><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728760"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">device_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="device_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3728813"></a><code class="varname">device_id</code></h6></div></div></div>
	  Identifies the input device to be removed.
	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728822"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728828"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p>

	  <span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span>
	</p></div></div><div class="section" title="AddGestureType"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728842"></a><code class="function">AddGestureType</code></h4></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728848"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><p>
	Adds gesture type to the filter.
	A filter will allow gesture of only those types that have been added.
      </p><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">type_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="type_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3728908"></a><code class="varname">type_id</code></h6></div></div></div><p>

	    Identifies the gesture type to add to the filter.
	  </p><p>
	    The special value
	    <code class="constant">GEIS_ALL_GESTURE_TYPES</code>
	    may be used to create a filter that will allow gestures
	    of all available types.
	  </p><p>
	    The default action of a filter is
	    to allow no gesture types to be recognized.
	  </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728936"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728946"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  <span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span>

	</p></div></div><div class="section" title="RemoveGestureType"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3728960"></a><code class="function">RemoveGestureType</code></h4></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3728968"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><p>
	Removes a gesture type from the filter.
      </p><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">type_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="type_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3729025"></a><code class="varname">type_id</code></h6></div></div></div>
	  Identifies the gesture_type to remove from the filter.
	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729035"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729044"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p>

	  <span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span>
	</p></div></div><div class="section" title="AddRegion"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729059"></a><code class="function">AddRegion</code></h4></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729065"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><p>
	Adds a region to the filter.
	A filter will aloow gesture only on those regions added.
      </p><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">region_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="region_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3729124"></a><code class="varname">region_id</code></h6></div></div></div>

	  Identifies the region to be added to the filter.
	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729134"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729142"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  <span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span>
	</p></div></div><div class="section" title="RemoveRegion"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729158"></a><code class="function">RemoveRegion</code></h4></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729163"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><p>
	Removes a region from the filter.
      </p><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">region_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="region_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3729222"></a><code class="varname">region_id</code></h6></div></div></div>

	  Identifies the region to be removed from the filter.
	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729231"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729240"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  <span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span>
	</p></div></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Subscriptions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3729255"></a>Subscriptions</h2></div></div></div><p>
    Subscriptions are aggregates of one or more filters,
    with optional flags,
    indicating to geis which gestures should be propagated.
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3729269"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Allowed Values</th><th>Default Value</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">subscription_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr><tr><td><code class="varname">subscription_flags</code></td><td>see below</td><td>see below</td><td><code class="constant">GEIS_SUBSCRIPTION_NONE</code></td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="subscription_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729351"></a><code class="varname">subscription_id</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

    Uniquely identifies the particular subscription.
    Generated automatically on creation of the subscription.
      </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Actions"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3729364"></a>Actions</h3></div></div></div><div class="section" title="CreateSubscription"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729369"></a><code class="function">CreateSubscription</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Creates a new empty subscription object.
	This action may be implemnted as a class constructor
	by the language bindings.
      </p><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729381"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">subscription_flags</code></td><td>(1)</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="subscription_flags"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3729436"></a><code class="varname">subscription_flags</code></h6></div></div></div><p>
	    Indicates special subscription actions.
	    Flag values may be logically ored together.
	  </p><p>

	    The following flags are defined.
	    </p><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Description</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_SUBSCRIPTION_NONE</code></td><td><p>
		      No special handling.
		  </p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_SUBSCRIPTION_GRAB</code></td><td><p>
		      Grabs all filtered gestures, even from any subregions.
		  </p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_SUBSCRIPTION_CONT</code></td><td><p>
		      Sends gesture continuations.
		  </p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>

	  </p></div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729526"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  Creates a new subscription object with a unique
	  <code class="varname">sunscription_id</code>.
	</p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729540"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div></div><div class="section" title="DestroySubscription"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729552"></a><code class="function">DestroySubscription</code></h4></div></div></div><p>
	Destroys an existing subscription.
	This action may be implemnted as a class destructor or finalizer
	by the language bindings.
      </p><div class="section" title="Arguments"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729565"></a>Arguments</h5></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Direction</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">subscription_id</code></td><td>cardinal</td><td>in</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="subscription_id"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h6 class="title"><a id="id3729617"></a><code class="varname">subscription_id</code></h6></div></div></div>

	  Identifies the subscription to destroy.
	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729627"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p>
	  Destroys an identified subscription.
	  Further operations on the subscription are invalid
	  and will raise an error condition.
	</p><p>
	  Filters associated with the subscription remain valid.
	</p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729643"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div></div><div class="section" title="AddFilter"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729656"></a><code class="function">AddFilter</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

	</div></div><div class="section" title="Effects on State"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729725"></a>Effects on State</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div><div class="section" title="Errors"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h5 class="title"><a id="id3729735"></a>Errors</h5></div></div></div><p><span class="emphasis"><em>(to be documented)</em></span></p></div></div><div class="section" title="RemoveFilter"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729746"></a><code class="function">RemoveFilter</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

	  Identifies the filter to be removed.
	</div></div></div></div></div><div class="section" title="Events"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h2 class="title" style="clear: both"><a id="id3729825"></a>Events</h2></div></div></div><p>
    During initial geis setup,
    events will be delivered to indicate the availability of
    various input devices and gesture types.
    Once subscriptions are in place, additional events will indicate gesture
    transitions and, possibly, other touch events.
  </p><p>
    Events have an <span class="emphasis"><em>event type</em></span> and a list of attributes specific to each type, as documented below.
  </p><div class="section" title="State Variables"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h3 class="title"><a id="id3729847"></a>State Variables</h3></div></div></div><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Data Type</th><th>Allowed Values</th><th>Default Value</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="varname">event_type</code></td><td><span class="type">GeisEventType</span></td><td>n/a</td><td>n/a</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class="section" title="event_type"><div class="titlepage"><div><div><h4 class="title"><a id="id3729910"></a><code class="varname">event_type</code></h4></div></div></div><p>

	Distinguishes the type of the event received.
	<span class="type">GeisEventType</span> has at least the following values.
	</p><div class="informaltable"><table border="1"><colgroup><col /><col /></colgroup><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Description</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_DEVICE_AVAILABLE</code></td><td><p>
		  A new gesture-capable input device has become available.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE</code></td><td><p>
		  A gesture-capable input device has become unavailable.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_GESTURE_TYPE_AVAILABLE</code></td><td><p>

		  A new gesture type has become available.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_GESTURE_TYPE_UNAVAILABLE</code></td><td><p>
		   A gesture type has become unavailable.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_GESTURE_STARTED</code></td><td><p>
		    A new gesture has started.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_GESTURE_UPDATED</code></td><td><p>
		    A gesture has updated its state.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_GESTURE_FINISHED</code></td><td><p>
		    A gesture has updated its state
		    and has been recognized as finishing.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_TOUCH</code></td><td><p>

		    Reports touch events that are
		    not part of a recognized gesture.
		</p></td></tr><tr><td><code class="constant">GEIS_EVENT_ERROR</code></td><td><p>
		    An error has been detected in
		    the underlying gesture recognition pipeline.
		</p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>
